radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver is homogeneous in echotexture without intra- or extra-hepatic biliary duct dilatation. The common bile duct is normal in caliber measuring 4 mm in diameter. The gallbladder is tense with two large roughly 1.8 cm gallstones with surrounding sludge with wall thickening up to 5 mm and trace perihepatic/pericholecystic fluid. Sonographic Murphy's sign is positive. The spleen is homogeneous in echotexture measuring 12.7 cm. Limited sagittal views of the right kidney are grossly unremarkable, without hydronephrosis.
